questions.question: I ……………………… my grandparents about twice a month.
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about habits.

questions.question: I ……………………… a lot of movies these days.
questions.description: We use the present continuous to talk about actions and situations that are going on around now.

questions.question: I asked her whether she …………………………. in God.
questions.description: When the main verb is in the past tense, we usually use a past tense in the subordinate clause.

questions.question: I ………………………… him since our school days.
questions.description: We use the present perfect to say how a long a present situation has been going on.

questions.question: I …………………………… English since
questions.description: We use the present perfect or the present perfect continuous tense to say how a long a present situation has been going on.

questions.question: Where …………………. snakes live?
questions.description: We use the simple present to talk about permanent situations.

questions.question: I ……………………… this fragrance very much.
questions.description: The verb like is not normally used in the continuous form.

questions.question: I promise I ………………………… this to anyone.
questions.description: We do not normally use the simple present tense to talk about the future.

questions.question: We ………………………. to the movies tonight.
questions.description: We use the present continuous to talk about a future event that has already been planned.

questions.question: I ………………………. my job tomorrow.
questions.description: The simple present is used to talk about time tabled future events. The present continuous can also be used to talk about a pre-planned future event.

questions.question: Why ……………………… you take a holiday?
questions.description: We mainly use the simple present tense in suggestions.

questions.question: The climate …………………….. warmer.
questions.description: The present continuous is used to talk about changing or developing situations.
